full_text: Schools must publish their admissions policies, including provisions for pupils who decline to participate in religious instruction
We are explicitly banning fees relating to admissions
We are banning waiting lists. This will end the discrimination against parents who move into a new area
It will ensure that where a school is not oversubscribed (around 80% of all schools) it must admit all students applying
This Bill is about fairness and making it easier for parents to enrol their children in a school that meets their needs
The Education (Admission to Schools) Bill will be at Dáil committee stage this evening, I'll be proposing a number of amendments

We will continue to rollout our €210 million capital investment programme, based on learnings from best practice
I would like to take this opportunity to thank those on our Implementation Group, chaired by Brendan Tangney & made up of experts in field
We will introduce new ways for business & industry to support schools in embedding digital technologies in all aspects of their activities
We will review our policy on the ethical use of the internet and online safety for young people
Computer Science will be a leaving certificate subject option from 2018 and coding will become part of the primary maths curriculum
A programme of curriculum reforms will see #ICT embedded in all emerging curricular specifications #digital
We will develop a new clustering programme through which schools will collaborate with each other on innovative digital projects
The 2017 plan is the first in a series of annual plans to ensure that we are maximising the potential of digital tech in the classroom
